statement:
If $x_1,x_2,\ldots,x_n$ and $y_1,y_2,\ldots,y_n$ are two sequences (at
least one of them consisting of positive numbers):

-   if $x_1<x_2<\cdots<x_n$ and $y_1<y_2<\cdots<y_n$
    then$$\left(\frac{x_1+x_2+\cdots+x_n}{n}\right)\left(\frac{y_1+y_2+\cdots+y_n}{n}\right)
    \le\frac{x_1y_1+x_2y_2+\cdots+x_ny_n}{n}.$$

-   if $x_1<x_2<\cdots<x_n$ and $y_1>y_2>\cdots>y_n$
    then$$\left(\frac{x_1+x_2+\cdots+x_n}{n}\right)\left(\frac{y_1+y_2+\cdots+y_n}{n}\right)
    \ge\frac{x_1y_1+x_2y_2+\cdots+x_ny_n}{n}.$$
